 29 #ifndef TIMEZONE_H
 30 #define TIMEZONE_H
 31 
 32 #include "unicode/utypes.h"
 33 
 34 /**
 35  * \file
 36  * \brief C++ API: TimeZone object
 37  */
 38 
 39 #if !UCONFIG_NO_FORMATTING
 40 
 41 #include "unicode/uobject.h"
 42 #include "unicode/unistr.h"
 43 #include "unicode/ures.h"
 44 #include "unicode/ucal.h"
 45 
 46 U_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
 47 
 48 class StringEnumeration;
 49 
 50 /**
 51  *
 52  * <code>TimeZone</code> represents a time zone offset, and also figures out daylight
 53  * savings.
 54  *
 55  * <p>
 56  * Typically, you get a <code>TimeZone</code> using <code>createDefault</code>
 57  * which creates a <code>TimeZone</code> based on the time zone where the program
 58  * is running. For example, for a program running in Japan, <code>createDefault</code>
 59  * creates a <code>TimeZone</code> object based on Japanese Standard Time.
 60  *
 61  * <p>
 62  * You can also get a <code>TimeZone</code> using <code>createTimeZone</code> along
 63  * with a time zone ID. For instance, the time zone ID for the US Pacific
 64  * Time zone is "America/Los_Angeles". So, you can get a Pacific Time <code>TimeZone</code> object
 65  * with:
 66  * \htmlonly<blockquote>\endhtmlonly
 67  * <pre>
 68  * TimeZone *tz = TimeZone::createTimeZone("America/Los_Angeles");
 69  * </pre>
 70  * \htmlonly</blockquote>\endhtmlonly
 71  * You can use the <code>createEnumeration</code> method to iterate through
 72  * all the supported time zone IDs, or the <code>getCanonicalID</code> method to check
 73  * if a time zone ID is supported or not.  You can then choose a
 74  * supported ID to get a <code>TimeZone</code>.
 75  * If the time zone you want is not represented by one of the
 76  * supported IDs, then you can create a custom time zone ID with
 77  * the following syntax:
 78  *
 79  * \htmlonly<blockquote>\endhtmlonly
 80  * <pre>
 81  * GMT[+|-]hh[[:]mm]
 82  * </pre>
 83  * \htmlonly</blockquote>\endhtmlonly
 84  *
 85  * For example, you might specify GMT+14:00 as a custom
 86  * time zone ID.  The <code>TimeZone</code> that is returned
 87  * when you specify a custom time zone ID uses the specified
 88  * offset from GMT(=UTC) and does not observe daylight saving
 89  * time. For example, you might specify GMT+14:00 as a custom
 90  * time zone ID to create a TimeZone representing 14 hours ahead
 91  * of GMT (with no daylight saving time). In addition,
 92  * <code>getCanonicalID</code> can also be used to
 93  * normalize a custom time zone ID.
 94  *
 95  * TimeZone is an abstract class representing a time zone.  A TimeZone is needed for
 96  * Calendar to produce local time for a particular time zone.  A TimeZone comprises
 97  * three basic pieces of information:
 98  * <ul>
 99  *    <li>A time zone offset; that, is the number of milliseconds to add or subtract
100  *      from a time expressed in terms of GMT to convert it to the same time in that
101  *      time zone (without taking daylight savings time into account).</li>
102  *    <li>Logic necessary to take daylight savings time into account if daylight savings
103  *      time is observed in that time zone (e.g., the days and hours on which daylight
104  *      savings time begins and ends).</li>
105  *    <li>An ID.  This is a text string that uniquely identifies the time zone.</li>
106  * </ul>
107  *
108  * (Only the ID is actually implemented in TimeZone; subclasses of TimeZone may handle
109  * daylight savings time and GMT offset in different ways.  Currently we have the following
110  * TimeZone subclasses: RuleBasedTimeZone, SimpleTimeZone, and VTimeZone.)
111  * <P>
112  * The TimeZone class contains a static list containing a TimeZone object for every
113  * combination of GMT offset and daylight-savings time rules currently in use in the
114  * world, each with a unique ID.  Each ID consists of a region (usually a continent or
115  * ocean) and a city in that region, separated by a slash, (for example, US Pacific
116  * Time is "America/Los_Angeles.")  Because older versions of this class used
117  * three- or four-letter abbreviations instead, there is also a table that maps the older
118  * abbreviations to the newer ones (for example, "PST" maps to "America/Los_Angeles").
119  * Anywhere the API requires an ID, you can use either form.
120  * <P>
121  * To create a new TimeZone, you call the factory function TimeZone::createTimeZone()
122  * and pass it a time zone ID.  You can use the createEnumeration() function to
123  * obtain a list of all the time zone IDs recognized by createTimeZone().
124  * <P>
125  * You can also use TimeZone::createDefault() to create a TimeZone.  This function uses
126  * platform-specific APIs to produce a TimeZone for the time zone corresponding to
127  * the client's computer's physical location.  For example, if you're in Japan (assuming
128  * your machine is set up correctly), TimeZone::createDefault() will return a TimeZone
129  * for Japanese Standard Time ("Asia/Tokyo").
130  */
131 class U_I18N_API TimeZone : public UObject {
132 public:
133     /**
134      * @stable ICU 2.0
135      */
136     virtual ~TimeZone();
137 
138     /**
139      * Returns the "unknown" time zone.
140      * It behaves like the GMT/UTC time zone but has the
141      * <code>UCAL_UNKNOWN_ZONE_ID</code> = "Etc/Unknown".
142      * createTimeZone() returns a mutable clone of this time zone if the input ID is not recognized.
143      *
144      * @return the "unknown" time zone.
145      * @see UCAL_UNKNOWN_ZONE_ID
146      * @see createTimeZone
147      * @see getGMT
148      * @stable ICU 49
149      */
150     static const TimeZone& U_EXPORT2 getUnknown();
151 
152     /**
153      * The GMT (=UTC) time zone has a raw offset of zero and does not use daylight
154      * savings time. This is a commonly used time zone.
155      *
156      * <p>Note: For backward compatibility reason, the ID used by the time
157      * zone returned by this method is "GMT", although the ICU's canonical
158      * ID for the GMT time zone is "Etc/GMT".
159      *
160      * @return the GMT/UTC time zone.
161      * @see getUnknown
162      * @stable ICU 2.0
163      */
164     static const TimeZone* U_EXPORT2 getGMT(void);
165 
166     /**
167      * Creates a <code>TimeZone</code> for the given ID.
168      * @param ID the ID for a <code>TimeZone</code>, such as "America/Los_Angeles",
169      * or a custom ID such as "GMT-8:00".
170      * @return the specified <code>TimeZone</code>, or a mutable clone of getUnknown()
171      * if the given ID cannot be understood or if the given ID is "Etc/Unknown".
172      * The return result is guaranteed to be non-NULL.
173      * If you require that the specific zone asked for be returned,
174      * compare the result with getUnknown() or check the ID of the return result.
175      * @stable ICU 2.0
176      */
177     static TimeZone* U_EXPORT2 createTimeZone(const UnicodeString& ID);
178 
179     /**
180      * Returns an enumeration over system time zone IDs with the given
181      * filter conditions.
182      * @param zoneType      The system time zone type.
183      * @param region        The ISO 3166 two-letter country code or UN M.49
184      *                      three-digit area code. When NULL, no filtering
185      *                      done by region.
186      * @param rawOffset     An offset from GMT in milliseconds, ignoring
187      *                      the effect of daylight savings time, if any.
188      *                      When NULL, no filtering done by zone offset.
189      * @param ec            Output param to filled in with a success or
190      *                      an error.
191      * @return an enumeration object, owned by the caller.
192      * @stable ICU 4.8
193      */
194     static StringEnumeration* U_EXPORT2 createTimeZoneIDEnumeration(
195         USystemTimeZoneType zoneType,
196         const char* region,
197         const int32_t* rawOffset,
198         UErrorCode& ec);
199 
200     /**
201      * Returns an enumeration over all recognized time zone IDs. (i.e.,
202      * all strings that createTimeZone() accepts)
203      *
204      * @return an enumeration object, owned by the caller.
205      * @stable ICU 2.4
206      */
207     static StringEnumeration* U_EXPORT2 createEnumeration();
208 
209     /**
210      * Returns an enumeration over time zone IDs with a given raw
211      * offset from GMT.  There may be several times zones with the
212      * same GMT offset that differ in the way they handle daylight
213      * savings time.  For example, the state of Arizona doesn't
214      * observe daylight savings time.  If you ask for the time zone
215      * IDs corresponding to GMT-7:00, you'll get back an enumeration
216      * over two time zone IDs: "America/Denver," which corresponds to
217      * Mountain Standard Time in the winter and Mountain Daylight Time
218      * in the summer, and "America/Phoenix", which corresponds to
219      * Mountain Standard Time year-round, even in the summer.
220      *
221      * @param rawOffset an offset from GMT in milliseconds, ignoring
222      * the effect of daylight savings time, if any
223      * @return an enumeration object, owned by the caller
224      * @stable ICU 2.4
225      */
226     static StringEnumeration* U_EXPORT2 createEnumeration(int32_t rawOffset);
227 
228     /**
229      * Returns an enumeration over time zone IDs associated with the
230      * given country.  Some zones are affiliated with no country
231      * (e.g., "UTC"); these may also be retrieved, as a group.
232      *
233      * @param country The ISO 3166 two-letter country code, or NULL to
234      * retrieve zones not affiliated with any country.
235      * @return an enumeration object, owned by the caller
236      * @stable ICU 2.4
237      */
238     static StringEnumeration* U_EXPORT2 createEnumeration(const char* country);
239 
240     /**
241      * Returns the number of IDs in the equivalency group that
242      * includes the given ID.  An equivalency group contains zones
243      * that have the same GMT offset and rules.
244      *
245      * <p>The returned count includes the given ID; it is always >= 1.
246      * The given ID must be a system time zone.  If it is not, returns
247      * zero.
248      * @param id a system time zone ID
249      * @return the number of zones in the equivalency group containing
250      * 'id', or zero if 'id' is not a valid system ID
251      * @see #getEquivalentID
252      * @stable ICU 2.0
253      */
254     static int32_t U_EXPORT2 countEquivalentIDs(const UnicodeString& id);
255 
256     /**
257      * Returns an ID in the equivalency group that
258      * includes the given ID.  An equivalency group contains zones
259      * that have the same GMT offset and rules.
260      *
261      * <p>The given index must be in the range 0..n-1, where n is the
262      * value returned by <code>countEquivalentIDs(id)</code>.  For
263      * some value of 'index', the returned value will be equal to the
264      * given id.  If the given id is not a valid system time zone, or
265      * if 'index' is out of range, then returns an empty string.
266      * @param id a system time zone ID
267      * @param index a value from 0 to n-1, where n is the value
268      * returned by <code>countEquivalentIDs(id)</code>
269      * @return the ID of the index-th zone in the equivalency group
270      * containing 'id', or an empty string if 'id' is not a valid
271      * system ID or 'index' is out of range
272      * @see #countEquivalentIDs
273      * @stable ICU 2.0
274      */
275     static const UnicodeString U_EXPORT2 getEquivalentID(const UnicodeString& id,
276                                                int32_t index);
277 
278     /**
279      * Creates an instance of TimeZone detected from the current host
280      * system configuration. If the host system detection routines fail,
281      * or if they specify a TimeZone or TimeZone offset which is not
282      * recognized, then the special TimeZone "Etc/Unknown" is returned.
283      *
284      * Note that ICU4C does not change the default time zone unless
285      * `TimeZone::adoptDefault(TimeZone*)` or
286      * `TimeZone::setDefault(const TimeZone&)` is explicitly called by a
287      * user. This method does not update the current ICU's default,
288      * and may return a different TimeZone from the one returned by
289      * `TimeZone::createDefault()`.
290      *
291      * <p>This function is not thread safe.</p>
292      *
293      * @return  A new instance of TimeZone detected from the current host system
294      *          configuration.
295      * @see adoptDefault
296      * @see setDefault
297      * @see createDefault
298      * @see getUnknown
299      * @stable ICU 55
300      */
301     static TimeZone* U_EXPORT2 detectHostTimeZone();
302 
303     /**
304      * Creates a new copy of the default TimeZone for this host. Unless the default time
305      * zone has already been set using adoptDefault() or setDefault(), the default is
306      * determined by querying the host system configuration. If the host system detection
307      * routines fail, or if they specify a TimeZone or TimeZone offset which is not
308      * recognized, then the special TimeZone "Etc/Unknown" is instantiated and made the
309      * default.
310      *
311      * @return   A default TimeZone. Clients are responsible for deleting the time zone
312      *           object returned.
313      * @see getUnknown
314      * @stable ICU 2.0
315      */
316     static TimeZone* U_EXPORT2 createDefault(void);
317 
318     /**
319      * Sets the default time zone (i.e., what's returned by createDefault()) to be the
320      * specified time zone.  If NULL is specified for the time zone, the default time
321      * zone is set to the default host time zone.  This call adopts the TimeZone object
322      * passed in; the client is no longer responsible for deleting it.
323      *
324      * <p>This function is not thread safe. It is an error for multiple threads
325      * to concurrently attempt to set the default time zone, or for any thread
326      * to attempt to reference the default zone while another thread is setting it.
327      *
328      * @param zone  A pointer to the new TimeZone object to use as the default.
329      * @stable ICU 2.0
330      */
331     static void U_EXPORT2 adoptDefault(TimeZone* zone);
332 
333 #ifndef U_HIDE_SYSTEM_API
334     /**
335      * Same as adoptDefault(), except that the TimeZone object passed in is NOT adopted;
336      * the caller remains responsible for deleting it.
337      *
338      * <p>See the thread safety note under adoptDefault().
339      *
340      * @param zone  The given timezone.
341      * @system
342      * @stable ICU 2.0
343      */
344     static void U_EXPORT2 setDefault(const TimeZone& zone);
345 #endif  /* U_HIDE_SYSTEM_API */
346 
347     /**
348      * Returns the timezone data version currently used by ICU.
349      * @param status Output param to filled in with a success or an error.
350      * @return the version string, such as "2007f"
351      * @stable ICU 3.8
352      */
353     static const char* U_EXPORT2 getTZDataVersion(UErrorCode& status);
354 
355     /**
356      * Returns the canonical system timezone ID or the normalized
357      * custom time zone ID for the given time zone ID.
358      * @param id            The input time zone ID to be canonicalized.
359      * @param canonicalID   Receives the canonical system time zone ID
360      *                      or the custom time zone ID in normalized format.
361      * @param status        Receives the status.  When the given time zone ID
362      *                      is neither a known system time zone ID nor a
363      *                      valid custom time zone ID, U_ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT_ERROR
364      *                      is set.
365      * @return A reference to the result.
366      * @stable ICU 4.0
367      */
368     static UnicodeString& U_EXPORT2 getCanonicalID(const UnicodeString& id,
369         UnicodeString& canonicalID, UErrorCode& status);
370 
371     /**
372      * Returns the canonical system time zone ID or the normalized
373      * custom time zone ID for the given time zone ID.
374      * @param id            The input time zone ID to be canonicalized.
375      * @param canonicalID   Receives the canonical system time zone ID
376      *                      or the custom time zone ID in normalized format.
377      * @param isSystemID    Receives if the given ID is a known system
378      *                      time zone ID.
379      * @param status        Receives the status.  When the given time zone ID
380      *                      is neither a known system time zone ID nor a
381      *                      valid custom time zone ID, U_ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT_ERROR
382      *                      is set.
383      * @return A reference to the result.
384      * @stable ICU 4.0
385      */
386     static UnicodeString& U_EXPORT2 getCanonicalID(const UnicodeString& id,
387         UnicodeString& canonicalID, UBool& isSystemID, UErrorCode& status);
388 
389     /**
390     * Converts a system time zone ID to an equivalent Windows time zone ID. For example,
391     * Windows time zone ID "Pacific Standard Time" is returned for input "America/Los_Angeles".
392     *
393     * <p>There are system time zones that cannot be mapped to Windows zones. When the input
394     * system time zone ID is unknown or unmappable to a Windows time zone, then the result will be
395     * empty, but the operation itself remains successful (no error status set on return).
396     *
397     * <p>This implementation utilizes <a href="http://unicode.org/cldr/charts/supplemental/zone_tzid.html">
398     * Zone-Tzid mapping data</a>. The mapping data is updated time to time. To get the latest changes,
399     * please read the ICU user guide section <a href="http://userguide.icu-project.org/datetime/timezone#TOC-Updating-the-Time-Zone-Data">
400     * Updating the Time Zone Data</a>.
401     *
402     * @param id        A system time zone ID.
403     * @param winid     Receives a Windows time zone ID. When the input system time zone ID is unknown
404     *                  or unmappable to a Windows time zone ID, then an empty string is set on return.
405     * @param status    Receives the status.
406     * @return          A reference to the result (<code>winid</code>).
407     * @see getIDForWindowsID
408     *
409     * @stable ICU 52
410     */
411     static UnicodeString& U_EXPORT2 getWindowsID(const UnicodeString& id,
412         UnicodeString& winid, UErrorCode& status);
413 
414     /**
415     * Converts a Windows time zone ID to an equivalent system time zone ID
416     * for a region. For example, system time zone ID "America/Los_Angeles" is returned
417     * for input Windows ID "Pacific Standard Time" and region "US" (or <code>null</code>),
418     * "America/Vancouver" is returned for the same Windows ID "Pacific Standard Time" and
419     * region "CA".
420     *
421     * <p>Not all Windows time zones can be mapped to system time zones. When the input
422     * Windows time zone ID is unknown or unmappable to a system time zone, then the result
423     * will be empty, but the operation itself remains successful (no error status set on return).
424     *
425     * <p>This implementation utilizes <a href="http://unicode.org/cldr/charts/supplemental/zone_tzid.html">
426     * Zone-Tzid mapping data</a>. The mapping data is updated time to time. To get the latest changes,
427     * please read the ICU user guide section <a href="http://userguide.icu-project.org/datetime/timezone#TOC-Updating-the-Time-Zone-Data">
428     * Updating the Time Zone Data</a>.
429     *
430     * @param winid     A Windows time zone ID.
431     * @param region    A null-terminated region code, or <code>NULL</code> if no regional preference.
432     * @param id        Receives a system time zone ID. When the input Windows time zone ID is unknown
433     *                  or unmappable to a system time zone ID, then an empty string is set on return.
434     * @param status    Receives the status.
435     * @return          A reference to the result (<code>id</code>).
436     * @see getWindowsID
437     *
438     * @stable ICU 52
439     */
440     static UnicodeString& U_EXPORT2 getIDForWindowsID(const UnicodeString& winid, const char* region,
441         UnicodeString& id, UErrorCode& status);
442 
443     /**
444      * Returns true if the two TimeZones are equal.  (The TimeZone version only compares
445      * IDs, but subclasses are expected to also compare the fields they add.)
446      *
447      * @param that  The TimeZone object to be compared with.
448      * @return      True if the given TimeZone is equal to this TimeZone; false
449      *              otherwise.
450      * @stable ICU 2.0
451      */
452     virtual UBool operator==(const TimeZone& that) const;
453 
454     /**
455      * Returns true if the two TimeZones are NOT equal; that is, if operator==() returns
456      * false.
457      *
458      * @param that  The TimeZone object to be compared with.
459      * @return      True if the given TimeZone is not equal to this TimeZone; false
460      *              otherwise.
461      * @stable ICU 2.0
462      */
463     UBool operator!=(const TimeZone& that) const {return !operator==(that);}
464 
465     /**
466      * Returns the TimeZone's adjusted GMT offset (i.e., the number of milliseconds to add
467      * to GMT to get local time in this time zone, taking daylight savings time into
468      * account) as of a particular reference date.  The reference date is used to determine
469      * whether daylight savings time is in effect and needs to be figured into the offset
470      * that is returned (in other words, what is the adjusted GMT offset in this time zone
471      * at this particular date and time?).  For the time zones produced by createTimeZone(),
472      * the reference data is specified according to the Gregorian calendar, and the date
473      * and time fields are local standard time.
474      *
475      * <p>Note: Don't call this method. Instead, call the getOffset(UDate...) overload,
476      * which returns both the raw and the DST offset for a given time. This method
477      * is retained only for backward compatibility.
478      *
479      * @param era        The reference date's era
480      * @param year       The reference date's year
481      * @param month      The reference date's month (0-based; 0 is January)
482      * @param day        The reference date's day-in-month (1-based)
483      * @param dayOfWeek  The reference date's day-of-week (1-based; 1 is Sunday)
484      * @param millis     The reference date's milliseconds in day, local standard time
485      * @param status     Output param to filled in with a success or an error.
486      * @return           The offset in milliseconds to add to GMT to get local time.
487      * @stable ICU 2.0
488      */
489     virtual int32_t getOffset(uint8_t era, int32_t year, int32_t month, int32_t day,
490                               uint8_t dayOfWeek, int32_t millis, UErrorCode& status) const = 0;
491 
492     /**
493      * Gets the time zone offset, for current date, modified in case of
494      * daylight savings. This is the offset to add *to* UTC to get local time.
495      *
496      * <p>Note: Don't call this method. Instead, call the getOffset(UDate...) overload,
497      * which returns both the raw and the DST offset for a given time. This method
498      * is retained only for backward compatibility.
499      *
500      * @param era the era of the given date.
501      * @param year the year in the given date.
502      * @param month the month in the given date.
503      * Month is 0-based. e.g., 0 for January.
504      * @param day the day-in-month of the given date.
505      * @param dayOfWeek the day-of-week of the given date.
506      * @param milliseconds the millis in day in <em>standard</em> local time.
507      * @param monthLength the length of the given month in days.
508      * @param status     Output param to filled in with a success or an error.
509      * @return the offset to add *to* GMT to get local time.
510      * @stable ICU 2.0
511      */
512     virtual int32_t getOffset(uint8_t era, int32_t year, int32_t month, int32_t day,
513                            uint8_t dayOfWeek, int32_t milliseconds,
514                            int32_t monthLength, UErrorCode& status) const = 0;
515 
516     /**
517      * Returns the time zone raw and GMT offset for the given moment
518      * in time.  Upon return, local-millis = GMT-millis + rawOffset +
519      * dstOffset.  All computations are performed in the proleptic
520      * Gregorian calendar.  The default implementation in the TimeZone
521      * class delegates to the 8-argument getOffset().
522      *
523      * @param date moment in time for which to return offsets, in
524      * units of milliseconds from January 1, 1970 0:00 GMT, either GMT
525      * time or local wall time, depending on `local'.
526      * @param local if true, `date' is local wall time; otherwise it
527      * is in GMT time.
528      * @param rawOffset output parameter to receive the raw offset, that
529      * is, the offset not including DST adjustments
530      * @param dstOffset output parameter to receive the DST offset,
531      * that is, the offset to be added to `rawOffset' to obtain the
532      * total offset between local and GMT time. If DST is not in
533      * effect, this value is zero; otherwise it is a positive value,
534      * typically one hour.
535      * @param ec input-output error code
536      *
537      * @stable ICU 2.8
538      */
539     virtual void getOffset(UDate date, UBool local, int32_t& rawOffset,
540                            int32_t& dstOffset, UErrorCode& ec) const;
541 
542     /**
543      * Sets the TimeZone's raw GMT offset (i.e., the number of milliseconds to add
544      * to GMT to get local time, before taking daylight savings time into account).
545      *
546      * @param offsetMillis  The new raw GMT offset for this time zone.
547      * @stable ICU 2.0
548      */
549     virtual void setRawOffset(int32_t offsetMillis) = 0;
550 
551     /**
552      * Returns the TimeZone's raw GMT offset (i.e., the number of milliseconds to add
553      * to GMT to get local time, before taking daylight savings time into account).
554      *
555      * @return   The TimeZone's raw GMT offset.
556      * @stable ICU 2.0
557      */
558     virtual int32_t getRawOffset(void) const = 0;
559 
560     /**
561      * Fills in "ID" with the TimeZone's ID.
562      *
563      * @param ID  Receives this TimeZone's ID.
564      * @return    A reference to 'ID'
565      * @stable ICU 2.0
566      */
567     UnicodeString& getID(UnicodeString& ID) const;
568 
569     /**
570      * Sets the TimeZone's ID to the specified value.  This doesn't affect any other
571      * fields (for example, if you say<
572      * blockquote><pre>
573      * .     TimeZone* foo = TimeZone::createTimeZone("America/New_York");
574      * .     foo.setID("America/Los_Angeles");
575      * </pre>\htmlonly</blockquote>\endhtmlonly
576      * the time zone's GMT offset and daylight-savings rules don't change to those for
577      * Los Angeles.  They're still those for New York.  Only the ID has changed.)
578      *
579      * @param ID  The new time zone ID.
580      * @stable ICU 2.0
581      */
582     void setID(const UnicodeString& ID);
583 
584     /**
585      * Enum for use with getDisplayName
586      * @stable ICU 2.4
587      */
588     enum EDisplayType {
589         /**
590          * Selector for short display name
591          * @stable ICU 2.4
592          */
593         SHORT = 1,
594         /**
595          * Selector for long display name
596          * @stable ICU 2.4
597          */
598         LONG,
599         /**
600          * Selector for short generic display name
601          * @stable ICU 4.4
602          */
603         SHORT_GENERIC,
604         /**
605          * Selector for long generic display name
606          * @stable ICU 4.4
607          */
608         LONG_GENERIC,
609         /**
610          * Selector for short display name derived
611          * from time zone offset
612          * @stable ICU 4.4
613          */
614         SHORT_GMT,
615         /**
616          * Selector for long display name derived
617          * from time zone offset
618          * @stable ICU 4.4
619          */
620         LONG_GMT,
621         /**
622          * Selector for short display name derived
623          * from the time zone's fallback name
624          * @stable ICU 4.4
625          */
626         SHORT_COMMONLY_USED,
627         /**
628          * Selector for long display name derived
629          * from the time zone's fallback name
630          * @stable ICU 4.4
631          */
632         GENERIC_LOCATION
633     };
634 
635     /**
636      * Returns a name of this time zone suitable for presentation to the user
637      * in the default locale.
638      * This method returns the long name, not including daylight savings.
639      * If the display name is not available for the locale,
640      * then this method returns a string in the localized GMT offset format
641      * such as <code>GMT[+-]HH:mm</code>.
642      * @param result the human-readable name of this time zone in the default locale.
643      * @return       A reference to 'result'.
644      * @stable ICU 2.0
645      */
646     UnicodeString& getDisplayName(UnicodeString& result) const;
647 
648     /**
649      * Returns a name of this time zone suitable for presentation to the user
650      * in the specified locale.
651      * This method returns the long name, not including daylight savings.
652      * If the display name is not available for the locale,
653      * then this method returns a string in the localized GMT offset format
654      * such as <code>GMT[+-]HH:mm</code>.
655      * @param locale the locale in which to supply the display name.
656      * @param result the human-readable name of this time zone in the given locale
657      *               or in the default locale if the given locale is not recognized.
658      * @return       A reference to 'result'.
659      * @stable ICU 2.0
660      */
661     UnicodeString& getDisplayName(const Locale& locale, UnicodeString& result) const;
662 
663     /**
664      * Returns a name of this time zone suitable for presentation to the user
665      * in the default locale.
666      * If the display name is not available for the locale,
667      * then this method returns a string in the localized GMT offset format
668      * such as <code>GMT[+-]HH:mm</code>.
669      * @param inDaylight if true, return the daylight savings name.
670      * @param style
671      * @param result the human-readable name of this time zone in the default locale.
672      * @return       A reference to 'result'.
673      * @stable ICU 2.0
674      */
675     UnicodeString& getDisplayName(UBool inDaylight, EDisplayType style, UnicodeString& result) const;
676 
677     /**
678      * Returns a name of this time zone suitable for presentation to the user
679      * in the specified locale.
680      * If the display name is not available for the locale,
681      * then this method returns a string in the localized GMT offset format
682      * such as <code>GMT[+-]HH:mm</code>.
683      * @param inDaylight if true, return the daylight savings name.
684      * @param style
685      * @param locale the locale in which to supply the display name.
686      * @param result the human-readable name of this time zone in the given locale
687      *               or in the default locale if the given locale is not recognized.
688      * @return       A reference to 'result'.
689      * @stable ICU 2.0
690      */
691     UnicodeString& getDisplayName(UBool inDaylight, EDisplayType style, const Locale& locale, UnicodeString& result) const;
692 
693     /**
694      * Queries if this time zone uses daylight savings time.
695      * @return true if this time zone uses daylight savings time,
696      * false, otherwise.
697      * <p><strong>Note:</strong>The default implementation of
698      * ICU TimeZone uses the tz database, which supports historic
699      * rule changes, for system time zones. With the implementation,
700      * there are time zones that used daylight savings time in the
701      * past, but no longer used currently. For example, Asia/Tokyo has
702      * never used daylight savings time since 1951. Most clients would
703      * expect that this method to return <code>FALSE</code> for such case.
704      * The default implementation of this method returns <code>TRUE</code>
705      * when the time zone uses daylight savings time in the current
706      * (Gregorian) calendar year.
707      * <p>In Java 7, <code>observesDaylightTime()</code> was added in
708      * addition to <code>useDaylightTime()</code>. In Java, <code>useDaylightTime()</code>
709      * only checks if daylight saving time is observed by the last known
710      * rule. This specification might not be what most users would expect
711      * if daylight saving time is currently observed, but not scheduled
712      * in future. In this case, Java's <code>userDaylightTime()</code> returns
713      * <code>false</code>. To resolve the issue, Java 7 added <code>observesDaylightTime()</code>,
714      * which takes the current rule into account. The method <code>observesDaylightTime()</code>
715      * was added in ICU4J for supporting API signature compatibility with JDK.
716      * In general, ICU4C also provides JDK compatible methods, but the current
717      * implementation <code>userDaylightTime()</code> serves the purpose
718      * (takes the current rule into account), <code>observesDaylightTime()</code>
719      * is not added in ICU4C. In addition to <code>useDaylightTime()</code>, ICU4C
720      * <code>BasicTimeZone</code> class (Note that <code>TimeZone::createTimeZone(const UnicodeString &ID)</code>
721      * always returns a <code>BasicTimeZone</code>) provides a series of methods allowing
722      * historic and future time zone rule iteration, so you can check if daylight saving
723      * time is observed or not within a given period.
724      *
725      * @stable ICU 2.0
726      */
727     virtual UBool useDaylightTime(void) const = 0;
728 
729     /**
730      * Queries if the given date is in daylight savings time in
731      * this time zone.
732      * This method is wasteful since it creates a new GregorianCalendar and
733      * deletes it each time it is called. This is a deprecated method
734      * and provided only for Java compatibility.
735      *
736      * @param date the given UDate.
737      * @param status Output param filled in with success/error code.
738      * @return true if the given date is in daylight savings time,
739      * false, otherwise.
740      * @deprecated ICU 2.4. Use Calendar::inDaylightTime() instead.
741      */
742     virtual UBool inDaylightTime(UDate date, UErrorCode& status) const = 0;
743 
744     /**
745      * Returns true if this zone has the same rule and offset as another zone.
746      * That is, if this zone differs only in ID, if at all.
747      * @param other the <code>TimeZone</code> object to be compared with
748      * @return true if the given zone is the same as this one,
749      * with the possible exception of the ID
750      * @stable ICU 2.0
751      */
752     virtual UBool hasSameRules(const TimeZone& other) const;
753 
754     /**
755      * Clones TimeZone objects polymorphically. Clients are responsible for deleting
756      * the TimeZone object cloned.
757      *
758      * @return   A new copy of this TimeZone object.
759      * @stable ICU 2.0
760      */
761     virtual TimeZone* clone(void) const = 0;
762 
763     /**
764      * Return the class ID for this class.  This is useful only for
765      * comparing to a return value from getDynamicClassID().
766      * @return The class ID for all objects of this class.
767      * @stable ICU 2.0
768      */
769     static UClassID U_EXPORT2 getStaticClassID(void);
770 
771     /**
772      * Returns a unique class ID POLYMORPHICALLY. This method is to
773      * implement a simple version of RTTI, since not all C++ compilers support genuine
774      * RTTI. Polymorphic operator==() and clone() methods call this method.
775      * <P>
776      * Concrete subclasses of TimeZone must use the UOBJECT_DEFINE_RTTI_IMPLEMENTATION
777      *  macro from uobject.h in their implementation to provide correct RTTI information.
778      * @return   The class ID for this object. All objects of a given class have the
779      *           same class ID. Objects of other classes have different class IDs.
780      * @stable ICU 2.0
781      */
782     virtual UClassID getDynamicClassID(void) const = 0;
783 
784     /**
785      * Returns the amount of time to be added to local standard time
786      * to get local wall clock time.
787      * <p>
788      * The default implementation always returns 3600000 milliseconds
789      * (i.e., one hour) if this time zone observes Daylight Saving
790      * Time. Otherwise, 0 (zero) is returned.
791      * <p>
792      * If an underlying TimeZone implementation subclass supports
793      * historical Daylight Saving Time changes, this method returns
794      * the known latest daylight saving value.
795      *
796      * @return the amount of saving time in milliseconds
797      * @stable ICU 3.6
798      */
799     virtual int32_t getDSTSavings() const;
800 
801     /**
802      * Gets the region code associated with the given
803      * system time zone ID. The region code is either ISO 3166
804      * 2-letter country code or UN M.49 3-digit area code.
805      * When the time zone is not associated with a specific location,
806      * for example - "Etc/UTC", "EST5EDT", then this method returns
807      * "001" (UN M.49 area code for World).
808      *
809      * @param id            The system time zone ID.
810      * @param region        Output buffer for receiving the region code.
811      * @param capacity      The size of the output buffer.
812      * @param status        Receives the status.  When the given time zone ID
813      *                      is not a known system time zone ID,
814      *                      U_ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT_ERROR is set.
815      * @return The length of the output region code.
816      * @stable ICU 4.8
817      */
818     static int32_t U_EXPORT2 getRegion(const UnicodeString& id,
819         char *region, int32_t capacity, UErrorCode& status);
820 
821 protected:
822 
823     /**
824      * Default constructor.  ID is initialized to the empty string.
825      * @stable ICU 2.0
826      */
827     TimeZone();
828 
829     /**
830      * Construct a TimeZone with a given ID.
831      * @param id a system time zone ID
832      * @stable ICU 2.0
833      */
834     TimeZone(const UnicodeString &id);
835 
836     /**
837      * Copy constructor.
838      * @param source the object to be copied.
839      * @stable ICU 2.0
840      */
841     TimeZone(const TimeZone& source);
842 
843     /**
844      * Default assignment operator.
845      * @param right the object to be copied.
846      * @stable ICU 2.0
847      */
848     TimeZone& operator=(const TimeZone& right);
849 
850 #ifndef U_HIDE_INTERNAL_API
851     /**
852      * Utility function. For internally loading rule data.
853      * @param top Top resource bundle for tz data
854      * @param ruleid ID of rule to load
855      * @param oldbundle Old bundle to reuse or NULL
856      * @param status Status parameter
857      * @return either a new bundle or *oldbundle
858      * @internal
859      */
860     static UResourceBundle* loadRule(const UResourceBundle* top, const UnicodeString& ruleid, UResourceBundle* oldbundle, UErrorCode&status);
861 #endif  /* U_HIDE_INTERNAL_API */
862 
863 private:
864     friend class ZoneMeta;
865 
866 
867     static TimeZone*        createCustomTimeZone(const UnicodeString&); // Creates a time zone based on the string.
868 
869     /**
870      * Finds the given ID in the Olson tzdata. If the given ID is found in the tzdata,
871      * returns the pointer to the ID resource. This method is exposed through ZoneMeta class
872      * for ICU internal implementation and useful for building hashtable using a time zone
873      * ID as a key.
874      * @param id zone id string
875      * @return the pointer of the ID resource, or NULL.
876      */
877     static const char16_t* findID(const UnicodeString& id);
878 
879     /**
880      * Resolve a link in Olson tzdata.  When the given id is known and it's not a link,
881      * the id itself is returned.  When the given id is known and it is a link, then
882      * dereferenced zone id is returned.  When the given id is unknown, then it returns
883      * NULL.
884      * @param id zone id string
885      * @return the dereferenced zone or NULL
886      */
887     static const char16_t* dereferOlsonLink(const UnicodeString& id);
888 
889     /**
890      * Returns the region code associated with the given zone,
891      * or NULL if the zone is not known.
892      * @param id zone id string
893      * @return the region associated with the given zone
894      */
895     static const char16_t* getRegion(const UnicodeString& id);
896 
897   public:
898 #ifndef U_HIDE_INTERNAL_API
899     /**
900      * Returns the region code associated with the given zone,
901      * or NULL if the zone is not known.
902      * @param id zone id string
903      * @param status Status parameter
904      * @return the region associated with the given zone
905      * @internal
906      */
907     static const char16_t* getRegion(const UnicodeString& id, UErrorCode& status);
908 #endif  /* U_HIDE_INTERNAL_API */
909 
910   private:
911     /**
912      * Parses the given custom time zone identifier
913      * @param id id A string of the form GMT[+-]hh:mm, GMT[+-]hhmm, or
914      * GMT[+-]hh.
915      * @param sign Receves parsed sign, 1 for positive, -1 for negative.
916      * @param hour Receives parsed hour field
917      * @param minute Receives parsed minute field
918      * @param second Receives parsed second field
919      * @return Returns TRUE when the given custom id is valid.
920      */
921     static UBool parseCustomID(const UnicodeString& id, int32_t& sign, int32_t& hour,
922         int32_t& minute, int32_t& second);
923 
924     /**
925      * Parse a custom time zone identifier and return the normalized
926      * custom time zone identifier for the given custom id string.
927      * @param id a string of the form GMT[+-]hh:mm, GMT[+-]hhmm, or
928      * GMT[+-]hh.
929      * @param normalized Receives the normalized custom ID
930      * @param status Receives the status.  When the input ID string is invalid,
931      * U_ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT_ERROR is set.
932      * @return The normalized custom id string.
933     */
934     static UnicodeString& getCustomID(const UnicodeString& id, UnicodeString& normalized,
935         UErrorCode& status);
936 
937     /**
938      * Returns the normalized custom time zone ID for the given offset fields.
939      * @param hour offset hours
940      * @param min offset minutes
941      * @param sec offset seconds
942      * @param negative sign of the offset, TRUE for negative offset.
943      * @param id Receves the format result (normalized custom ID)
944      * @return The reference to id
945      */
946     static UnicodeString& formatCustomID(int32_t hour, int32_t min, int32_t sec,
947         UBool negative, UnicodeString& id);
948 
949     UnicodeString           fID;    // this time zone's ID
950 
951     friend class TZEnumeration;
952 };
953 
954 
955 // -------------------------------------
956 
957 inline UnicodeString&
958 TimeZone::getID(UnicodeString& ID) const
959 {
960     ID = fID;
961     return ID;
962 }
963 
964 // -------------------------------------
965 
966 inline void
967 TimeZone::setID(const UnicodeString& ID)
968 {
969     fID = ID;
970 }
971 U_NAMESPACE_END
972 
973 #endif /* #if !UCONFIG_NO_FORMATTING */
974 
975 #endif //_TIMEZONE
976 //eof
